challenges.title: Write your first Fraction
description: To write your first vertical fraction using LaTeX, you'll need to add \frac{1}{2}, where 1 and 2 can be any valid expression or number.
Notice that if you don't use this special syntax (for example 3/4), the fraction will be rendered horizontally. If you did it correctly the fraction will be rendered vertically
In LaTeX, is necessary to enclose every math expressions between \[ \] or $$ $$
challengeSeed: % Write your LaTeX expression inside the delimiters
tests: assert(/(\\\[.*\\\]|\$\$.*\$\$)/g.test(expression), 'message: The expression should be enclosed by Math LaTeX equation delimiters \[ \] or $$ $$')
assert(/\\frac(\s*{.*}\s*{.*}|\s*(\d|\w)\s*(\d|\w))/g.test(expression), 'message: The expression should have a valid fraction.')

challenges.title: Compare Fractions that have Common Denominators
description: When comparing fractions with the same denominator, we can just compare the numerators.
For example, if we compare 3/5 and 4/5 we are comparing 3 lots of 1/5 and 4 lots of 1/5. Since 3 is less than 4, 3/7 < 4/7.
challengeSeed: % Replace the ? below with \lt (less than), \gt (greater than) or = (equal).
tests: assert(/\\frac\{7\}\{9\}\s*\\gt\s*\\frac\{4\}\{9\}/g.test(expression), 'message: Add the correct comparison operator between the fractions.')
